Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Phenomenal Staff”
Reviews.Author: cll45
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Every staff person at the hotel went out of his way to be friendly and helpful and this really made our stay something special. Rooms were very nice as was the restaurant. Quick and easy shuttle to the airport every 10-15 minutes. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: albiejnr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect stop for LAX airport. There is a free shuttle service to the hotel which takes a few minutes, the check in was extremely fast which is a bonus after a long flight. The room was clean and had everything we needed. The beds were very comfortable and we enjoyed a good nights sleep. It is well worth getting a breakfast inclusive rate because we paid about $20 extra on the room rate for breakfast and the cost is more than that if you pay separately. The breakfast was a huge array of everything you could want and well worth the money. We booked a car with Hertz which is an easy walk from the hotel. The hotel also stored our bags for the day while we went out which was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Hype”
Reviews.Author: TheOtherLeft
Reviews.Content: I was slightly skeptical about the almost glowing reviews of the Renaissance, but, having spent the night, I can say perhaps what every airport hotel hopes to hear most: the Renaissance Montura feels like a "true" hotel, rather than a place to crash before an early flight the next day. The check-in staff was both very professional and friendly, with the sort of crisp attitude that often seems lacking at 9 p.m. among airport-hotel employees. The lobby and public rooms are stylish and appealing, and would not feel out of place downtown. The hotel perhaps aspires to be a little more chic than it can credibly pull off, given its location and purpose as airport lodging, but the bar seemed lively and people appeared to enjoy themselves in the sitting area near the entrance. My room was fully functional, on the smaller end for a four-star hotel but in keeping with other higher-end airport hotels at which I've stayed. The bathroom was fresh and relatively spacious, making up for the slightly utilitarian, though very clean, nature of the bedroom itself. Regrettably, Renaissance, like the rest of the Marriott chain, does charge an exorbitant rate -- roughly $15 a night -- for Internet access. A friend met me the next morning in his car, leaving it in the hotel's convenient garage. Realizing that we'd left the parking card in my room after check-out, I went back to the front desk, which immediately billed my credit card for two hours of parking without any questions and put the credit on my room key, so that I simply needed to swipe the key card at the garage exit and was on my way. A very intelligent and convenient system. It may be ambitious and its guest rooms may lack for excitement, but the Renaissance Montura is a respectable and comfortable hotel that has managed to define itself independent of LAX. I would strongly recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best Marriott branded LAX hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4959keeton
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel to be close to LAX for a morning flight. As a Marriott elite, they had originally upgraded me to the Concierge level. For some reason, they fouled up the room assignment so they relocated me to a lower floor, but it was a suite (sweet!). Great front desk staff. My room faced away from the airport and was dead quiet. The room was perfectly clean but you could tell it wasn't brand new. The TV was a flat screen with actual HD programming and the clock radio actually had decent sound quality. The wireless internet was OK for e-mail and web surfing, but was a litte slow for video streaming. The restaurant was very good, but pricey. The only other walkable dining options I found were the Burger King across the street or other area hotels. The Concierge lounge had above-average offerings for the evening hors d'oeuvres and morning breakfast. The airport shuttle is shared with the LAX Marriott so at peak times it can already be crowded when it picks up at the Renaissance. Parking is rather expensive ($25 self / $32 valet plus tax/tip) but there seemed to be plenty of on-street parking nearby. If you rent from Avis or Hertz, their lots are directly across the street so you can pick up (or drop off) your car by walking over and not have to deal with the hotel parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for LAX”
Reviews.Author: jensamsmom
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay near LAX for a very early airport. The Renaissance was very closeby with an airport shuttle. The check in staff was pleasant and courteous, surprisingly so for an airport hotel. The room was on the small side but big enough for one night. The major drawback was the towels were a bit dingy like they were either old or not cleaned with bleach. I cannot say the room was unclean but it was not sparkling. At $139 per night, you could not beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient to LAX”
Reviews.Author: female_traveller_100
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Renaissance (Mariott brand) adjacent to LAX for one night in order to catch an early flight out of LAX the next morning. Booked 2 double rooms (for myself and friends) at AAA club rate of $94 per room - a reasonable price. Although close to the airport, rooms are very quiet - did not even notice noise from other guests. The beds are impeccably clean and super-comfortable. Rooms were spacious and very clean, with large, clean bathrooms (granite counter) and a safe in-room (a security feature I appreciate). The elevators are fast-moving and numerous enough that we did not have to wait more than several seconds for our lift (although we checked-in late and left early). Requested a 5am wake-up call to catch an early morning flight, and the front desk called right at 5am on the button. This hotel advertises free 24hr shuttle to LAX. Front desk recommended arriving in the lobby 1/2 hr before the desired departure time from the hotel, however we did not have to wait more than about 5-10 minutes (at 6am) for the airport shuttle to arrive. Very quick and convenient. Only experienced one glitch: requested rooms on the same floor that were adjacent to each other, one with feather-free bedding. Initially was offered rooms on separate floors, but the check-in agent accommodated my request for rooms on the same floor (although they were not adjacent to each other - in fact they were situated at opposite ends of the hotel). As a result of this room-shuffling, I did not receive feather-free bedding - remedied the situation by taking an antihistamine to keep my allergies in check, so it turned out okay. Overall I was impressed with the property's convenient location, cleanliness and efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Phenomenal Staff”
Reviews.Author: JFP
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Renaissance LAX. I chose it for location, value and secured/guaranteed parking. The staff was friendly, courteous, welcoming and helpful from minute one. The staff at the front desk was phenomenal and accommodating. The room itself was good-sized. The bed was unbelievably comfortable, and there was no airport noise even though my window overlooked a busy runway. The only reason I couldn't give the room 5 stars was some carpet wear, paint dings and a lack of lighting, but really not a big deal. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a early morning or late arrival flight”
Reviews.Author: nldogbert
Reviews.Content: Location: Good for LAX. Shuttle is provided 24 hours with no fix schedule. It is a shared shuttle with the Marriott LAX and frequency is good. Reception: This hotel has the newer designed modern reception area. Check in was fast and staff friendly. Room: Typical Renaissance type room. Flat TV with good number of program selection. Bed was comfortable and windows sufficiently soundproofed from aircraft taking off. Bathroom: Well sized with typical amenities. In general, a good hotel and location. There is also a Concierge lounge which seems to be open even during the weekends with limited service. Only during the weekdays there are full lounge service. Though I did not try it, was glad to see that luckily not all lounges in the Marriott system are closed in the weekends. From my room, I had a view of the open air swimming pool and jacuzzi. Takes about 5 mins to reach the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal on Rate, But...”
Reviews.Author: AVSENT
Reviews.Content: This was clean, upscale type of hotel. It rated at four stars but, I would give it about 3. The staff was helpful and friendly that is always a plus. I got a room on the 5th floor overlooking the back, (not a great view). Again, the room was kept well as was the rest of the hotel(good considering it's age). It was close to LAX and food places(it had a restaurant or two), and a casino. I got the rate by bidding well below the rate on priceline and was sure it would be rejected. To my surprise it was accepted. It is about what I would pay for this quality of hotel(worth the few dollars more than what I would have paid at homestead suites). Drawbacks, parking is between 24(self)-34(valet) USD. Or, park on the street if you can find a spot(I did). It is not included in the rate but, should be. Nor, is it mentioned in the hotel description. Most hotels in this area charge heavily for this. I would recommend it for location, cleanliness, and staff. Otherwise, with parking and high rate you could do better. Again, a very nice looking hotel otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great room”
Reviews.Author: joeboy1015
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't stay at this property due to the previous negative reviews. I'm currently in Room 706 and have no complaints whatsoever. The room is nice and clean, quiet from nearby LAX noise, and the staff has been very responsive. The hotel is a little old meaning its not brand new but it is in very good condition. The bed mattress, pillows, and linens are exceptional; the bathroom is spotless. The room has new flat panel TVs with good HD signal rather than just digital that I get in a lot of properties. The fitness center has individual television screens at every station so you can watch TV if you need the distraction. No good restaurants nearby but that's not why you stay at an airport property anyway. Burger King across the street, but the famous Inn-n-Out burger about an easy half-mile stroll away. Would definitely stay here again, especially if I can get the two-week advance purchase rate. Free wi-fi in lobby only, otherwise a stiff fee...as expected.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great”
Reviews.Author: muntechx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night as I had an early flight. Was a little nervous after reading some of the negative reviews but I shared none of their experiences. The hotel has a beautiful foyer, very nice restaurants and I found the staff helpful. The food in the restaurant, while a little pricey but was good eg Burger and fries and a beer cost me $20. The room was great, nice comfortable bed and i enjoyed watching the LCD TV. There were plenty of free channels to choose from on the TV. Bathroom was spotless. Caught the shuttle early to the airport in the morning with no dramas. Checked out with no problems over the phone as well. Will definitely stay again. Managed to get a deal for $94 per night with AAA card.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: l0vebug
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was an average hotel with an average stay. I'd recommend it for it's great, close location to the airport. Check your bill very carefully, however. I had two charges that weren't mine (a bar/restaurant charge and an extra internet charge). The staff was hesitant to remove the charges, but they did.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in another hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Scholpa
Reviews.Content: We stay in Renaissance for 1 nigth and the hotel is terrible! Dark ,old and i have to sleep in the floor the matress are old, for the same money stay in sheraton getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel, with free airport...”
Reviews.Author: Mezza76au
Reviews.Content: Good airport hotel, with free airport transfers and good clean rooms. We stayed here as a stop over on our way to NY and enjoyed the one night. Close to Manhatten beach which is very pretty. Small rattle in the air con was a downside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: Located right across the street from Budget Rental Car on Airport Drive at LAX airport. Very convenient for beating the traffic by turning in your rental car the evening before a flight, then taking a hotel shuttle over to the airport in the morning. Very nice, upscale decor in the lobby and sleeping rooms. Flatscreen, high def TVs. Only downside was noisy air conditioner in the room. Delicious "foodie" dinner through room service (I had porcini crusted N.Y. strip steak, blue cheese spinach au gratin, charred Vidalia onion, and arugula salad). Front desk staff is helpful and friendly. Free airline boarding pass printer in the lobby area. I got free high speed wired internet in the room because I'm a Marriott Rewards Silver member. Another big plus! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you need a place close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Nogranny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning and the end of a trip. It's close to the airport and the shuttle was timely. However, you aren't really near any restaurants or shopping of any kind. There is a Burger King directly across but that's it. The food in the restaurant is excellent but very pricey. The breakfast buffet was incredible, I am just grateful we got a summer special with the buffet included, it was nearly $20 per person. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. Although the air conditioner was very loud. The views from the hotel are nothing to remember...parking lots and roads. The pool was very small. This is not a hotel that you would want to spend a week in for a vacation. It really is a fantastic place to stay if you get in late or have a very early flight in the morning. So for a pass through traveler...YES For a vacation with a family...NO

Reviews.Title: “will never return...”
Reviews.Author: dimtze
Reviews.Content: a hotel that anyone must skip they will try to get rip off by any way they can be warned

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has a great restaurant, the best beds and very well decorated.”
Reviews.Author: Snooge42
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for one night in transit. We were impressed by excellent food in restaurant, beautiful artwork in lobby, very friendly service and great beds. We would choose this hotel for future stay overs in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fee Happy”
Reviews.Author: ConnAWR
Reviews.Content: Great place to be near LAX. Very nice looking. I cannot stand a hotel that charges you for internet use along with parking. It's just not acceptable. Esp if you are a hotel member. Rooms were ok. you really didn't hear the planes unless you open your window. There are other places to stay who aren't as fee happy. Pool is very very small for this size hotel.

Reviews.Title: “miserable stay”
Reviews.Author: nikos_globe
Reviews.Content: just hate it, everything was a problem there and the manager was the reasson everything we ask was not solve location is really bad its like to visit new york and stay at jfk dont recommented it

Reviews.Title: “Too much noise from the hallway”
Reviews.Author: MaybeHome
Reviews.Content: This hotel was over-rated. It was supposed to be the best of the LAX hotels, but there was way too much noise in the hallways and from the airport. A good airport hotels at least is soundproof from the landing planes. This hotel had thin doors and lots of hallway noise too. There are lots of hotels at the airport, pick another. Also the parking garage was too small.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located airport hotel with old interior”
Reviews.Author: jfoxy82207
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance with my younger sister for one night before flying out from LAX in the morning. We got a good deal on Priceline for 65$. The hotel is nothing special. The rooms are quite old. The beds were really nice though. The airconditioning in the room was crazily loud. The hotel provides Aveeda products in the bathroom which I really enjoyed. The pool and hottub are quite small and crowded when we wanted to use them at 10pm. There is a Burger King right across the street. The hotel shuttle runs frequently and gets you to the terminals in less than 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room But a little Dated”
Reviews.Author: dansocal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 14 days this past June. The staff are excellent, the beds excellent. The decor needs updating... The room service food needs a revamp. Overall a great hotel, easy to self park, very quiet rooms and not a ton of walking. The other bonus of the room is that you can completely control the room temperature... which you can't do at Westin. This might not be the fanciest hotel but it is my first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Does not meet Marriott standard.”
Reviews.Author: hydragea93
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a couple of nights at Renaissance Hotel. We use Marriott hotels a lot, so this review is from a platinum elite member. Unfortunately, Renaissance Hotel did not meet the standard of what we know of Marriott. At the check in, they were fine to send us to the room on the 3rd floor looking at the mechanical system on the roof knowing the status. We changed. The conceirge lounge was out of late night snack only after one hour they began to serve. The arrival gift did not arrive at that night even after we asked. The clerk told us to do so next day and it was completely forgotten. We asked again and finally arrived way after the dinner time; ended up changing the item from what we wanted because it was so late. What I found was the reception desk clerk was pleasant and just did not mean anything she said. Later, he realized he left his blue tooth in the room and called the desk and asked for it. The clerk was pretty rude. My husband regretted, out of all the Marriott places he stays, Renaissance was the place he happened to leave the item. Imagine their service to general customers if that's the service we get as a status customer. Since it was a short stay near the airport, we did not pay much for this hotel. Found that's what we got, but that was not anything near Marriott experience even from their Courtyard level. One positive thing I need to mention is the house keepers are great. They keep the relatively run down place very clean and very friendly. I am guessing they keep that hotel running.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ameripean
Reviews.Content: My wife was flying in from Singapore and I was flying to meet her from Atlanta. The Renaissance was the perfect rendezvous. We wanted a convenient hotel close to LAX that provided an airport pick-up and had 24 hour room service. After reading many dozen reviews, we settled on the Renaissance even though the price was a bit more. I am happy to say we were VERY satisfied. The hotel is 10 minutes (at most) from LAX. You will probably spend more time waiting for the free shuttle then the actual ride to the hotel. The hotel is modest, comfortable and modern. I have stayed at a lot of airport hotels for business and this ranks as one of the best. Make no mistake, this is not a resort but the rooms are big, comfortable and very quiet! From our window, we could watch plans coming in on the north runway of LAX but the rooms were well protected against sound. Parking is very pricey but that is to be expected in such close proximity to the airport. We rented a car for 1 day from Avis which just happens to be caddy corner to the hotel. When I returned the car the following day, it took me 5 min to walk back to the hotel - excellent location. The Airport Shuttle departs the hotel about every 30 minutes making quick connections. We liked the hotel and would definitely stay there again if we needed a short stop over.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT book at this place”
Reviews.Author: JackieBlogs
Reviews.Content: The pictures of the hotel look very deceiving. A few hours prior to my arrival, I called to confirm my stay and my king mattress request to which the front desk agent replied that it was all ready and that they had plenty of king matt rooms. I arrived to get 2 full beds instead. On top of it, the bed had bugs; i was moved to another room. The internet was down and spend over an hour for help. The free promo travel vouchers were not offered and was told that they only give them upon check out at front desk, isnt this convenient? they do this so you forget during your rushed check out and they fail to remind you. The cost for this place is definitely not worth the stay. You can get better accomodations at this same price. This place looks nice outside, lobby, and bar/lounge, everything else is similar to a travelodge inn place.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: Shellybells82
Reviews.Content: Really close to the airport, but we did not hear any airplane noise in our 2 night stay. Parking was a bit tough at night as the garage would get pretty full. Our room did have a refrigerator. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. While nice, the hotel is definitely not on par with any other Renaissance properties we had been to. It was more like a Marriott. But it was convenient to most of our destinations in the LA area. Self-parking is $25 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: MartinAdrogué
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through AA.com and got a 79usd fare per night. For that price, this hotel was highly satisfying. The location wasn´t glamorous but it was very convenient, close to the airport (I arrived by midnight so that was a good thing) and with easy access to most freeways. The room wasn´t particularly big but it was comfortable. The bed was what you would expect for a chain hotel like this one -great sleep. Bathroom and décor were just average. I didn´t request much from the hotel staff so I can´t say much about the service. I had a nice stay and I would definitely stay here again if I got a similar rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: RyryE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for one night on a layover at LAX. It was easily one of the cleanest and most comfortable airport hotels I've stayed at. It has very quick and convenient shuttle, and for a hotel this close to LAX, it is extremely quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: MKHargrave
Reviews.Content: Extremely nice airport hotel, we received upgraded room upon arrival. Their restaurant (ate dinner and breakfast buffet) was excellent, and wait staff was wonderful! The airport shuttle was a great convenience as well as the computer in the business center for printing airline boarding passes. The only problem was the lack of hot water while showering, but we would definitely return again when leaving from LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: lacalif11
Reviews.Content: I got this 4* through Priceline.com ($70/nite with taxes & fees). I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Comfortable & clean room. On-site parking; polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cold showers”
Reviews.Author: travelbyme
Reviews.Content: Check in last night 5/26/10, caught the shuttle from LAX and after one stop at the Marriott LAX we arrived at the Renaissance. Checking in was a breeze at 11pm, the female receptionist was very sweet and helpful and quick. I asked for a late checkout of 1pm and she extended my check out to 3pm...only problem i was on the 2nd floor, should have asked for a higher floor but that was my mistake. Took a shower at midnight and the water was cool, not cold not warm just cool, Not good! but something i've read about this hotel more than a couple of times so i was not surprised. The room was smallish but very comfortable and the bed was very comfortable with 6 pillows. Awoke at 7:30am and took a shower, again the water was cool. I had breakfast downstairs at the 96st Bistro in the Lobby, buffet was $19, omletes, bacon, sausage, fresh fruits, breads: all and all very simple, not a lot of selections but it was okay, service was very good. Burger King is across the street if you're interested. I had a great sleep, i ate well, i had a cool shower and i got a good deal from priceline. I was satisfied. ps... in room wireless internet is $12.95, in the lobby where you'll find people on their laptops i believe it is free.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable place to stay near LAX”
Reviews.Author: weileongtan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February after an evening arrival (departed the next morning). It was alright. No particular complaints. Burger King across the street. My room was not affected by aircraft noise.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at LAX”
Reviews.Author: joeyknows
Reviews.Content: Spent a comfortable night at Renaissance Montura at LAX. Nice updated Hotel. Registration efficient & friendly. Dinner and breakfast decent hotel fare. Clean & well maintained. Our room and bath were spacious. Plenty of hot water with good pressure; an issue for some of the Hotels at LAX. Hotel staff always has a friendly greeting for guests. If you have to stay at the Airport I highly recommend this hotel. definitely better than the rest and about the same price too.

Reviews.Title: “If you like hot water when you shower, this is not your hotel!”
Reviews.Author: theflygirl
Reviews.Content: Everything was fabulous at this hotel till I had to wake up at 4:30 to catch a flight, and had NO hot water. When I asked the front desk, she seemed to indicate that it is a problem that they've had before. Also, their 'free' shuttle was not running on schedule, which made me have to hop in a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Four star for a motel price”
Reviews.Author: amp-qld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for two nights before flying out of LAX. The price we paid was hardly any more than for the Days Inn we'd stayed at on arrival a few weeks earlier. The room was great and the concierge was very helpful. Naturally, there's a complimentary airport shuttle. As we had a late night flight, we were allowed to use the fitness centre for a shower and change of clothes before going to the airport. The hotel's in a good location for bus services to Hollywood etc. Free wifi was available in the lobby. I find 4/5* hotels that charge for internet access very annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveluser
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great, reasonably priced hotel near LAX, you can't go wrong with the Renaissance. The service was excellent, and the upgraded room was spacious and terrific. The location is convenient, and the free shuttle made our early morning trip to the airport smooth and easy. Though our stay was brief, we were very pleased with our choice of this property.

Reviews.Title: “Although somewhat dated, great LAX hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yum E
Reviews.Content: As all of the corporate-approved hotels near Hollywood were fully booked, I ended up booking a room at the Renaissance by LAX. Upon arrival, I noticed that the property was somewhat dated on the outside. The check-in was quick and easy. Self-Parking is listed as $23/day, but may be cheaper if you have a corporate rate! ;) I did have trouble entering the garage as the card reader malfunctioned?!? I ended up backing up and going back to the front desk to get it resolved... My request for a high-level, away from the elevator room was honored. Despite being so close to LAX, my room was surprisingly quiet as I never heard any planes.... However, I did hear someone blowing their nose in the hallway?!? as well as an employee slipping my bill through the door at 2 am... The bed was excellent and I had a great night sleep. The internet is $14.95 and may be waived if you have a corporate rate! ;) The restroom did have a musty smell to it...Perhaps a little additional air freshener would have been helpful! ...lastly the A/C unit in my room was rumbling every time it kicked in...I thought it would disturb me...but it never bothered me during my sleeping hours! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but probably won't return”
Reviews.Author: LovetoScuba
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance before a Saturday morning flight on the Club level. Unfortunately the Club is closed from Friday evening until Monday morning except for sodas, water, and coffee. The room was attractive and comfortable. There was one comfy chair and one desk chair for sitting. When we went for coffee in the lounge in the morning there was no cream, but we were able to hunt some down in the lobby. Internet access is $12.95 unless you want to sit in the lobby. “Wired for Business” also includes telephone calls, but I do not think I’ve used a hotel phone since, well, many years. Cell phones render land lines almost obsolete. We utilized the “park & fly” rate and left our car for 2 weeks. After paying for the additional days at the valet, we still had some trouble getting the car out of the lot, but it worked out. The airport shuttle was convenient both ways – just have to be careful to get on the right one since many of the hotel shuttles look the same. We have stayed at several LAX hotels to park and fly and I do not think that we will return to the Renaissance. It was disappointing that the Club was closed although the Marriott website advertises a “daily continental breakfast” and $12.95 is way too much for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Windows, Rude reception staff, 70's rooms”
Reviews.Author: bobo56
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be stripped of its Renaissance affiliation. The reception staff was the worst i have encountered in extensive traveling on 4 continents. Particularly one smug arrogant young male reception employee identified by his buddy holly thick black eyeglass frames. what a total jerk!!!! The room windows haven't been cleaned since construction and are barely visible through the grime. The rooms are dated with their decor and their Cathode Ray TV's aren't exactly cutting edge. Parking is a rip off at 27 dollars a day. STAY AWAY!! There are better LAX airport options!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: DGK13
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice within the past year and both times service was exceptional - prompt, courteous, efficient. On our first trip, we reserved and originally intended to stay two nights. Our flight was canceled, and we didn't arrive until late the next morning. We called and asked to maintain the reservation, so we could get into the room when we arrived. We were able to do so, and they only charged us for the one night instead of the two we reserved. Second time our stay was for only one night and we were on the top floor and were able to access the lounge. The rooms are clean and comfortable with nice amenities. We had breakfast in the restaurant and both food and service were good. I believe this hotel is smaller than some of the other airport hotels, which is an asset (unless you prefer crowds and lines...) Both times we felt the rooms were very quiet - didn't hear any noise. Nice exercise room and small pool. There is a free shuttle from the airport. You are in/near the airport, so there is not much in the immediate area or in terms of view, but certainly great location for early/late arriving or departing flights. Excellent value, particularly when you are able to get a rate in the low or below $100.

Reviews.Title: “All Good - Except the Bistro”
Reviews.Author: redhand
Reviews.Content: Someday, somewhere, somebody is going to make their fortune by inventing a bedroom door that shuts securely without slamming! We loved the comfort of the compact room with flat screen multi channel digital TV but our rest was constantly disturbed by the slamming of bedroom doors right up the hallway. Strange that we can go to the moon but can't invent a quiet door! Our only other disappointment was the 69 Bistro. We ordered filet on flat bread and left most of it on the plate as the salt was sickening. Good hotel for the money though, especially with Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite LAX hotel yet”
Reviews.Author: ahetzel
Reviews.Content: One night stay over ahead of a morning flight home to Hawaii from LAX and can say that the Renaissance is my favorite airport hotel in that area so far. WiFi access in the lobby area is free (which also from my low floor room), the bar area is tastefully designed and friendly; room was very comfortable. Staff service at the hotel seemed far better than the other big name hotels and the rooms were uncharacteristically quiet considering the proximity to the runways. The Hertz and Budget car lots are both only 2-3 blocks away, so no need to shuttle back and forth to the airport if returning a vehicle the night before departure. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Works Just Fine for a Layover”
Reviews.Author: doctorgooz
Reviews.Content: LA seems to have a wide variety of accomodations around LAX. If you can get a deal like I did (around $90 per night), I would not hesitate to stay here. My wife and I were heading out on a criuse the next day, and we flew into town the night before. LAX is not my favorite airport (I much prefer John Wayne, as an actor and and airport), and part of the hassle is the hotel shuttle service. There are a bunch of shared shuttles, bad signage, bad airport traffic flow, and not enough buses. Not the hotel's fault, but worth noting. The place itself had easy check in, pretty nice rooms, and solid noise insulation (a key factor at an airport hotel). The consierge was a bit clueless, but things happen late on a Friday night. Nice restaurant, with a pricey ($20) but very good breakfast buffet, and a Burger King across the street for those looking for something less expensive/fancy. Clean rooms, nice beds, good tvs, clean bathrooms - absolutely fine, especially at the price. As mentioned, on a value to quality ratio, this place is pretty darn good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: misslcp
Reviews.Content: A fab airport hotel - had all the service and amenties that you would want in an airport hotel. We stayed here as we had an early flight the next morning, and was very pleased we stayed here. Check in very quick and efficient. Staff very friendly and helpful. Room was great - spacious, clean, beds were unbelievably comfty - we didn't want to wake up! Gym - good size and lots of weights and machines Airport bus - quick, and regular Location - very close to airport as well as walking distance to all the car rentals - Budget is literally opposite the hotel. Breakfast - the breakfast buffet was great - really good food and a wide selection of cold and hot breakfast foods. The smoothies were amazing. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay near LA. It was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “This is how it should be done!”
Reviews.Author: ridcroft
Reviews.Content: When you stay in chain hotels it can be difficult to separate one from another in your memory. The Renaissance LAX stands out for me because the staff here consistently give service over and above the norm. Our room was on the club floors and was very comfortable though not as big a most US hotel rooms. The bathroom was the standard size with a good shower over a large tub. The Club lounge overlooks the runway at LAX. I spend a pleasant half hour watching planes in and out whilst drinking freshly brewed coffee from a Starbucks machine. The lounge provides a continental breakfast and, in the evening, pre-dinner snacks. Both offering a good selection, replenished regularly. there is also a dessert service late in the evening. As I mentioned earlier the differentiating thing at this hotel is the staff. From the shuttle bus driver onward everyone was friendly, helpful and genuinely concerned we enjoy our stay. This is such a refreshing change for an airport hotel and the management and staff are to be commended and encouraged. The restaurant adjacent to the lobby bar served good food and the breakfast here was superb. The waiting staff were attentive and knowledgeable, nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel with fantastic concierges”
Reviews.Author: NorthCoastTraveller
Reviews.Content: We traveled to LA for business on an extremely tight schedule and only stayed one night. The next time we have to travel to LA, I hope it's for more than one night, so I could see if the rest of the Renaissance experience holds up to the little I was able to see. That little bit was wonderful! From the location across the street from the rental car agency we used (Budget, which was a great savings on time when it came to returning the car before flying back out) to the small but well-appointed room with a good bed and the usual blanket-sandwich with high thread-count sheets. It took a few minutes to get really hot water to the shower, but otherwise there was no complaints about the room. The breakfast buffet, with a station for omelets, had a small but very fresh selection of breakfast meats, breads, cereals, yogurts and fruits, along with fresh juices and smoothies. The price was reasonable for an LA hotel buffet - IIRC around $15. The topper was the concierges, who loaned us an umbrella during "the most rain LA has seen in 10 years!" according to the weatherman on TV, and also gave us a map and tips on getting around on the surface streets, and reliable recommendations for all our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: profwho88
Reviews.Content: I was here once before, maybe 5 years ago, and thought it was good. This time, i'm thinking it's fab. The bed was super comfortable. The room was HUGELY quiet. No LAX noise at all, WOW. The LAX shuttle service was VERY good, the driver helped with my oversized bag, very good service. The restaurant needs more light (could barely read menu) but the service was GREAT and the food was REALLY GOOD. i'm actually a picky person when it comes to hotels, but this one was quite good and i'll be back when in LA. Really happy with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance at Airport”
Reviews.Author: Venkat_V
Reviews.Content: Not a bad one, expensive food, but I preferred since it was close to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great everything! Great first or last night in LAX area!”
Reviews.Author: travelmomEarth
Reviews.Content: Picked it for the location to the airport and the great prepaid internet rate. They put us on the club lounge level, very nice! We were coming from a 2 week cruise. (I wish the NCL cruise ship had the staff and the chef that this hotel had!!) Great food in dining room and the room service food was FABULOUS! My adult daughter got sick from the cruise and we had to extend our stay. They gave me the same discounted prepaid rate I had for the extended day, offered to have someone sit with my daughter while I ran to the pharmacy and the room service staff said they would fix whatever we needed even if it weren't on the menu!! All this for 79.00 US per night? I will never stay anywhere else in LA!!!

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some Bad...”
Reviews.Author: DieBroccoli
Reviews.Content: This was a quick trip to LA for business, so my stay in the Renaissance Montura was quick. However, i managed to test out many of the features and services they had to offer. First, the good: - Excellent service. Very attentive, friendly, and willing to please - Great location. Along with the complimentary airport shuttle, it was a breeze to get to and from the hotel - Room Service. I always order breakfast from room service and the meal arrived hot, fresh, and very tasty. Most room service, and especially for breakfast, arrives luke warm, and somewhat dry. not the case here. - Free WiFi in lobby. They also had power stations to plug in laptops, and made it very easy in general to take care of business. Now, the bad: - Rooms were a bit dingy. My room wasnt dirty per se, but it definitely had a worn feel and look about it - Showers. Barely warm water, and a shower head that could not have been more than 5'6". I am 6'4", so it was an awkward shower at best - NOT free WiFi in the rooms. I dont understand this, they have free WiFi in the lobby, why not in the rooms? And why is the free lobby WiFi not communicated to us? I paid $10 for internet in the room, only to find out the next morning that it was free in the lobby. We're only going to stand for $10-20 internet access for so long before we start changing our business travel habits accordingly. I am personally very close to only booking hotels that offer free WiFi, regardless of the other amenities. - The downstairs bar - bartender was very friendly, but $9 for a well vodka and cranberry? Are you serious? This isnt some hot spot and it wasnt saturday night. It was Tuesday afternoon in an empty hotel bar. $9 for a watered down drink? Finally, i rated Value at 3 stars. I got a great rate, but only through a discounter website. Full retail at this hotel would not be worth it in my opinion

Reviews.Title: “Needs cleaning (and maintenance)”
Reviews.Author: MIfamily92
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night, just for a place to stay while waiting for our late-night departure to Australia. Having read several positive reviews on tripadvisor, we were surprised at what we found when we checked in: a filthy pool, a well-worn and not real clean room, and a shower that had (at best) lukewarm water. The place was OK - we didn't feel unsafe there, and there were no obvious hazards - but it in no way was worth 4 stars (or the approx. $200 we paid). If you want a reasonably nice place, I'd advise looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to be near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Eurotravel
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and very close to the airport. We needed to be at the airport early in the morning, so this worked out well for us. The staff is very professional and friendly. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The area around the hotel is not pleasant for walking, it's like a concrete jungle with large hotels and industry. There are no restaurants in the immediate vicinity except for a fast food, Carls Jr. I think, across the street. The residential area down the road had several police cars the day we drove in, so probably not so safe either. But within 5 to 10 minutes drive you are in Marina Del Rey and Santa Monica. The only negative feedback I have for the hotel itself is that they should have a permanent coffee bar open. When I came down in the morning, hoping for some fresh coffee and pastries, the staff were all in the restaurant serving breakfast. When I asked about just purchasing some coffee they motioned me to the hotel bar, but there was no one there, so I just went upstairs and made my own coffee in the room. I think a hotel of this level should have a designated coffee bar. Also, the parking fee seemed high ($25 per night), but maybe that's standard. Otherwise, good hotel if you need to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT - GREAT - GREAT !”
Reviews.Author: Sebastianmiki
Reviews.Content: On our way back from Firenze, Italy we stayed at this hotel and after many other nights in hotels and apartments I have to say: I'm Very satisficed with the Renaissnase Hotel LAX. Clean, very modern, excellent bedding, huge 32 plasma tv, plenty pillows, free shuttle, you name it, is there and it's nice. The nice looby with modern decor and sophisticated lounge music and soft lighting makes you feel welcome as soon as you walk inside this nice hotel. Enjoy your stay in this very well priced, convenient and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: yanna
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed one night on Xmas, 2009 and loved the service,the bar area and bar menu, and just about everything for a relaxing time. We would both recommend the hotel for an airport overnight. stay. The rooms are very small but well equiped. Room service for breakfast was great. We had two rooms and plenty of hot water. What a nice respite before a morning flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor gets it right again”
Reviews.Author: ihilani
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Mexican Riviera cruise but missed my connection to Honolulu therefore I needed to stay over in LA. I decided to stay near the airport so I could catch my early morning flight the next day. The Renaissance Montura was wonderful. Beautiful lobby, clean rooms, great service. I had no problem sleeping on my king size bed. Due to the attempted terrorist attack on Christmas Day, I had heard that security was going to be extremely tightened so I was fortunate that I was already at the airport. I was able to catch an early hotel shuttle, get to the airport, check in and miss all the waiting in line. Thank you Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but the beds”
Reviews.Author: talk2me33
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and very efficient staff, the rooms are great but we all had a poor sleep due to discomfort in both beds. They are very soft with huge covers. Other that that very close to LAX with a free shuttle service , also close to car rental and service sttations for those returning cars Shame about internet fee's

Reviews.Title: “Feel at home here”
Reviews.Author: asrosen
Reviews.Content: I stay at this facility regularly when I go to LA on business. Front desk and club lounge staff is very friendly and accommodating. Club lounge (for elite Marriott members) is terrific--at no charge, full breakfast and enough hors d'oeuvres and, later, desserts to be called dinner. Available to use during the day too for relaxing or working. I have also found the food in the restaurant and lobby bar to be surprisingly good. Rooms are quite nice, especially if an upgrade to a suite is available. Only complaint (perhaps this has been fixed by now) is the video and sound in the fitness center. The machines and weights are fine, but typically each remote works several of the TVs (resulting in "dueling remotes"), the sound quality when using headphones is terrible, and the availability of channels is inconsistent from TV to TV. Nonetheless, I try to stay here every time I am working in the LAX area.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed our expectations”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller70
Reviews.Content: Surpassed our expectations. We were tierd after a long trip, and were met by a polite and welcoming Front Desk, especially Patrice who was abolsutely charming and managed to upgrade us to a nicer room. As we only had an afternoon in LA (but would be returning for longer later) and wanted to do something not too stressful, he recommended Manhattan Beach, which was accessible via a Trolley service 5 mins walk away from the hotel and only cost $3 each for a roundtrip! The rooms are modern, there is a nice pool, and you have access to complimentary soft drinks, nibbles and breakfast if you are lucky enough to be given Club Lounge access (although the alcoholic drinks are quite pricey). The rooms are equipped with a safe, coffee maker and Iron. Good sound proofing, so you are unlikley to hear any airport noise. We didn't attempt to head downtown on this visit, but were advised that the most practical way to do this was by Taxi. There is a free shuttle bus from the airport (tip the driver). There is a Budget Car opposite, but be warned about the rude Front Desk staff there. All in all, ee would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Among the best at LAX”
Reviews.Author: cookinma
Reviews.Content: There aren't many nice hotels at LAX, but the Renaissance is among the best. Lobby is beautiful, rooms are nice, and hotel is clean. It is comparable to the LAX Westin. It wasn't as nice as Renaissance hotels in other locations - not quite as luxurious

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Lumley
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before our flight out of L.A. First impression wasn't too good as the corridors were shabby. The room was a pleasant surprise, clean and nicely decorated and furnished. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and there was no aircraft noise at all. For $90 a night pretty good value, we hadn't expected the overnight parking to be quite as pricey though. The restaurant was expensive but the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Price, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Dogma
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night as a layover visit. We got a fantastic Priceline price ($55, $70 w/ taxes) and we're so glad we stayed here. Shuttle bus to hotel was free and we only waited 1 minute before it arrived at LAX and it only stops at one other hotel before the Renaissance. Check in was super fast and our king size room was very nice and quiet. We had a problem with hot water in bathroom and maintanance personnel were quick to respond and efficiently fixed the problem. Free wifi in the lobby (best connection near concierge desk and very bad near bar) and dropped a couple of times but it was better than paying the outrageous price in the room. It's a bit far to walk (if you're not used to 1/2 hour walks) for shopping and restaurants but it's easy and safe to do and concierge has a map for you.

Reviews.Title: “best breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PhilippinesWinnie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we arrived late and needed a hotel near the airport to spend the night. Hotel is very near the airport with free shuttle. Driver of the shuttle was very kind and helped with our luggages. When we arrived at the hotel, check-in was very quick. Hotel is very clean, very comfortable bed with clean sheets. Staff was very friendly. Breakfast was the best! Great variety of hot meals, fruits, juices, breads, cheese. Too bad we only stayed a night. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravelLady
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were very friendly & efficient. We arrived in the evening, and the concierge noticed there was a line for check-in, and rather than have us wait in line, she went ahead and us checked in. The room was spacious & clean. Although you could see the airport & planes arriving, we didn't hear a lot of noise. In fact, our room was very soundproof, my husband opened the window a crack and boy could you hear the noise, but once the windows were securely closed, it was very quiet. The restaurant at the hotel was very good. We ate 2 very good meals there - the buffet breakfast included a wide assortment of fruit, bread, cereals, pastries, potatoes, bacon, made-to-order omelets &pancakes. The dinner we had on our arrival night was excellent. The fitness center was somewhat small, but adequate - treadmills, stationery bikes, elliptical machines, free weights & some weight machines. Parking was a little pricey, but it is Los Angeles --- $32/day for valet & I think $25/day for regular parking. We walked over to the nearby Marriott airport hotel one morning for some Starbucks coffee, and it was EXTREMELY busy in the lobby. We definitely preferred our quiet & peaceful lobby. I booked this hotel directly through Marriott Hotels for $87/night. Although we usually stay downtown when visiting our son at USC, all those hotels were booked or extremely expensive, so we thought we'd give this hotel a try...and I'm glad we did. It took us about 25-30 minutes to get to USC on Friday morning (6:30am) I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Family friendly hotel near LAX”
Reviews.Author: tgnj00
Reviews.Content: This trendy, family friendly hotel is located within 2 miles of LAX. Although it is very modern, it is still a great hotel for families. The staff was friendly and knowledgable. They made us feel right at home from start to finish. There is a 24 hour shuttle that runs every 15 minutes to LAX. They also sale $3 tickets round trip to Manhattan Beach. Kids under 5 travel free. When we booked this hotel we did it for the convenient to LAX but never imagined there would be so much to also entertain us. The rooms were clean and well decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to the airport and rental car return, a pleasant experience.”
Reviews.Author: jsarchibald
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, which had many air crew checking in. This tells me it is a comfortable hotel, and it was. The rooms are spacious and the service is quite good. The only issue we had was the internet not working properly, as the details were incorrectly keyed for our room and resulted in calling another company to rectify. Once it was sorted, everything was great. We had a great night's sleep, and check out was a breeze. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to Airport, friendly staff - Perfect for a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: shakePacifica
Reviews.Content: We got in late to this hotel, and had gotten reservation through Priceline at a great price. Staff was very friendly in trying to get us our room, even though there were no more rooms with 2 queens that we had reserved. Instead we got upgraded to a Jr. Suite after some diligent work by the hotel clerk. I came back down and tipped her for her awesome help via a closed envelope. She smiled thinking it was just a thank you card. I guess when a guest comes down at 2:30am just to say thank you, they get surprised. The hotel, room, and stay were wonderful. If I head back to LA and need to stay close to LAX, this will be the hotel. Never heard any airplanes, walked to the car rental place, and even ran across the street to Burger King. Didn't get to try any of the hotel amenities, because we had arrived late and left early next day, so I can't comment - but I'm sure they are suitable for a 3.5 - 4 star hotel. Don't expect 4 seasons, and you wont get holiday inn either. Also if you are planning on renting a car, rent it the following day of your arrival if you arrive late to the hotel. That way you can save money on parking at the hotel, which I have heard is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to airport,”
Reviews.Author: mattlenderman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here our last night in LA to be near the airport since our flight was leaving rather early...got this place from Priceline for $55/night, and for as nice as the place is I felt like I got a steal. Yea they put my wife and I in a double bed room when it was obvious they had the room to put us in a king bedroom. When asking, they seem to use the "sorry its all we have for now plus you went through Priceline which is a 3rd party in which we can't guarantee the bed type when going through them". Far as the quality of this hotel, no complaints but the fact they seem to look down on your for booking through a 3rd party made me somewhat frustrated. This is the only reason i gave it a 4 star and not a 5. Everything else was fine... My thoughts are, if you're going to get an attitude w/ people going through Priceline, then DON'T work with them. Simple as that

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Early Departure out of LAX”
Reviews.Author: Jbswanso
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient, comfortable and the service is great. I typically stay here the night before whenever flying out of LAX early in the morning. Valet parking is nice too if you need to park your car while away on business.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nicely upscale, great location, pricy parking”
Reviews.Author: ReddPupp
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice upscale hotel. Very clean and quiet with incredibly luxurious beds. I always get a great deal on Priceline ($75) which makes up for the outrageous parking....$23 a night for self park. Also, even with a view of the runways at LAX it is very queit and you do not hear the planes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, great service”
Reviews.Author: mmeckstr
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean - the bed was comfortable, there was a decent sized LCD, and AVEDA body products were provided. We stayed in one night and did room service and the food was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and service! Convenient for LAX”
Reviews.Author: KKAustin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business so I wasn't able to select any other properties. That being said, I know I will choose to stay here in the future. The frequent shuttle service makes this easy to get to and from the airport. The hotel staff were second to none during my stay. Being a frequent traveler, I had access to the lounge. I found the food and selections to be ample and well stocked. My room was fine and standard Marriott decor. There was nothing amazing about it, but I have nothing negative to say about it either. The fitness center is very good here,but the small pool and hot tub was much smaller than I expected for a hotel of this size. I had to use the concierge service for a taxi, as well as storing luggage and they were very friendly and helpful. I will most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to stay, convenient shuttle to LAX”
Reviews.Author: holub78
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with swimming pool, fitness centre and great jacuzzi whirlpool. All you expect from the hotel of this class.It is worth to book in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Layover While Traveling Through LA”
Reviews.Author: cshager
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise on the Paul Gauguin. It was a good idea to break up the long flight from Chicago to Papeete. The hotel itself is very nice. The only complaint would be the very small and not so bubbly hot tub. We did eat at the lounge during Happy Hour and had some excellent drinks and food. The restaurant was quite expensive, but if the bar good is an indicaiton of the restaurant food, I am sure it is excellent. There is a Burger King across the street that we used for breakfast. We met a couple in the bar who had a layover and visited the bar while waiting for their flight. What a great idea! We had a great deal at this hotel booking through Priceline. I think we paid about $70. We woudl certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay arriving from Europe”
Reviews.Author: ciply
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of the free shuttlebus service and quality from Marriott The price was good(90.20$ with tax) for a 4 stars with all these amenities.Pool, fitness center, very cosy and modern room with all amenities. Check in very easy with help full staff. We arrived from a long direct flight from Europe and we needed a place for the first night of the trip and this hotel did its jobs very good. I would come back again, if I have to rest from a long trip.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location if fying in to LAX”
Reviews.Author: DawnOTD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for 2 nights on the Labor Day weekend. The hotel is very close to the Airport and right next to Buget Car rental if you need to rent a car. The prime reason for choosing this hotel is to be close to LAX. If like me, you'll be driving to attractions and spending most of the day visiting and only coming back at night to sleep, I say this is a great value for the money (we paid 85$ a night for King size bed). If you're not driving, then there isn't much to see in the nearby area.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable and consistent”
Reviews.Author: luv2travl003
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travel to LA regularly for client business. The airport location is convenient for us, and having tried nearly all of the LAX-area hotels, the renaissance has been consistently the best of the lot. To top it off, our client's rate makes it a relative bargain. The windows open (at least in many rooms - maybe not all), the air conditioning works (I'm not particularly tolerant of a hot room) and the club floor lounge offers coffee and bottled water all day (except over the weekend, which is too bad).

Reviews.Title: “Really comfortable and roomy”
Reviews.Author: Crazy33Italy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as I arrived in LA at midnight and was going to Hollywood the next day. I wanted a quiet place to sleep and have breakfast. This hotel really fulfilled my needs! The shuttle bus from the airport was quick and the room was so spacious, the king size bed huge and comfortable! So many pillows! Bathroom was a good size. The only odd thing was that the mirror was partially covered by the big flat TV! Breakfast was included in our rate and it was very nice: omelettes, pancakes, fresh fruit, cheese, and pastries, cereals, bacon, sausage, etc. The waiter though came to us with a bill that I needed to sign stating that breakfast was included and he pointed out that there was a gratuity option! He had done nothing and he wanted a tip anyway! I gave 2 dollars so he’d leave us alone. He didn’t even reply goodbye when we left!

Reviews.Title: “not great, ok for a night”
Reviews.Author: stijnec
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night to catch an early flight. Location is convenient, with complimentary shuttle to LAX. Lobby looks nice, and staff is very friendly. Unfortunately the rest of the hotel looks a bit tired, and in need of an update. Used the gym, it was ok, but not great. Pool is closed in the evening. Internet costs $ 13 per day. The shuttle is shared with other Mariott hotels, so it's possible the shuttle is full when it arrives at the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and great service”
Reviews.Author: breezey103
Reviews.Content: Spent just 1 night at the hotel before heading to Canada. Free shuttle from LAX was easy to find and took us right to the hotel. Check in was quick and staff very polite and efficient. Room was slightly dated, but more importantly, clean and comfortable. Concierge were great, providing us with information on where we could go for just a few hours. Would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay before a flight.”
Reviews.Author: usd2busmc
Reviews.Content: Been staying here for years as a Marriott rewards member. This was my first stay on a Priceline rate, and their commitment to service did not waiver. After a long week I wlll turn in my rental car at Budget (across the street) and walk across the way to the hotel. Staff is always friendly, and rooms are immaculate. Food is devent, but pricey. Free internet to Elite members. Has a good shuttle, but as Budget rental is right across the way i usually use that shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service for the price!”
Reviews.Author: 519snow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Friday, August 7th, before a return flight home on Saturday. We had asked when making our reservation about a rollaway bed for an additional guest, and had confirmed it with the hotel as well, but were informed upon our arrival that our room could not accomodate one. We were offered an air matress instead, which was totally fine, but there weren't any available for us to use. The friendly staff member checking us in offered us a free upgrade to a Junior Suite, as we are Marriott Rewards members, and this was able to accomodate the rollaway. We paid a rate of $119 US in total, which included a full buffet breakfast for two adults and two children, as well as the use of the hotel internet on the main floor for checking flight times, and the shuttle to the airport. Breakfast was really nice, with omelettes, waffles, pancakes, and eggs made especially for you, a great selection of fresh fruits, meats, cheese, and pastries, and the standard cereals, bacon, sausage, and home fries. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling near LAX!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff, quiet for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: CirceBaltimore
Reviews.Content: My husband travels frequently for business (I travel with him often when my work schedule permits it), and we always stay at this lovely hotel when we're in LA. It is very close to the airport and has its own shuttle bus which alleviates worries about getting to your flight on time. The staff here are very friendly and helpful with information, room upgrades, etc. The inside is beautifully decorated with gorgeous pictures on the wall and other artistic touches. I enjoy using the fitness room which is kept clean with working equipment, not always found in some four-star hotels. The best thing is that the rooms are so quiet that you always get a good night's sleep. They must be well sound proofed since you can't even hear the planes take off from nearby LAX. Having stayed in noisy hotels in the past, I can say that a quiet hotel is an important factor in enjoying a hotel stay whether for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Tops at LAX”
Reviews.Author: Fifegal
Reviews.Content: We have been to a lot of the hotels around LAX over the years but this is definitely one of the nicest. The staff are most helpful. Very good restaurant too.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: bluejax21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on my first night in the US after moving back from an overseas location. I'm a Platinum Elite Rewards Member with Marriott. The rooms at this hotel are probably due for a face lift. While I was given a room upgrade to what was a sizable room, there was a strange piece of what looked to be leftover furniture left in the room. The internet was not complimentary, which I did not like, and the mattress was a little strange, although I did not have any problems sleeping. The gym was surprisingly large and kept in good shape. The hotel charged for parking, which I did not like. The staff was friendly and helpful, from the porter to the desk staff. The desk staff was great at 3AM when I was looking for a late night snack due to my jet lag. I would be willing to stay at this hotel, but would hope it looked into some upgrade to its room appearance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: WMkr340
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my daughter on an apartment hunting trip. The hotel is extremely convenient to the surrounding areas (Marina del Rey, Playa del Rey, Redondo Beach, El Segundo, Santa Monica, Culver City). Never had to get on the 405 Freeway and most trips were only a 15 minute car ride on the surface streets. It is located blocks away from LAX, but really did not notice any jet noise while we slept. We were on the Surf & Turf plan which has parking and internet included. Parking alone is normally a $23 per day charge - this package was $15 extra above the cost of a room only and it also included high speed internet along with parking. The staff is very friendly and the restaurant is very good. We ate breakfast two mornings - the cost is higher than what you can find off property ($9 fruit plate is great - fresh and plenty to eat. The full breakfast buffet was $23. ) Although there are less expensive hotels, I felt this was an excellent value considering the comfort and location.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: WildeOneOshkosh
Reviews.Content: Convient to LAX. Didn't expect such superior service...what a pleasant surprise. Food and bar service were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “While this isn't ideal for a "fun" or "cool" hotel, it is convenient”
Reviews.Author: JetSetKen
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in an ideal location is you are looking to stay close to LAX. While the exterior isn't all that amazing, the interior is well done and newly renovated. The service is great and all the staff are friendly. The rooms are kept very clean and you have all the amenities of a 4-star hotel. Keep in mind that this is the kind of hotel that caters to those who want to be conveniently located near the airport, so it's not really close to any walkable "cool" areas. This hotel is also great for business travelers since they offer internet access in the rooms, WiFi in public areas and a business center. I tried their breakfast buffet once and it was good...it's great that they keep everything nice inside since the outside of the hotel and general neighborhood isn't all that spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Good Park & Fly Deal .... but ...”
Reviews.Author: David92263
Reviews.Content: Like most major international airports long term parking is something of an issue at Los Angeles International (LAX). I've tried it all ways including the generally very good Flyaway Bus service from Van Nuys. But when you have a fairly early departure and there are two of you it can definitely be more relaxing as well as economically viable, not to say part of the vacation, to consider a park-and-fly at one of the big hotels which cluster on the east side of the airport. There are a few to choose from on the internet and on this occasion I chose the Renaissance. The location is good - the shuttle bus only takes a few minutes to the terminals - and there is easy self parking in the structure behind the hotel. OK here's where the cautions come in. The rate for an overnight and 7 days parking was $209 (plus the inevitable tax); but my bill was for just south of $400 because we elected to eat in the hotel and have a couple of beers that evening. Breakfast option as a result was a quick run across the street to the Burger King. Now for even more care! On the return leg we got on the blue hotel bus only to discover that it dropped us at an entirely different hotel - thankfully less than 10 minutes walk of the Renaissance - but imagine schlepping two big bags after an overnight flight. Seems that more than one hotel has identical blue buses and that's a definite problem. To my shame I did not make a big fuss with the hotel as by then the valet was trying to charge me $48 for my extra night but billed as $11 on the hotel internet. For some bizarre reason the hotel takes payment for the package deal but not for those extra nights. So, as in all cases, try to be cautious.

Reviews.Title: “served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: luvfuninthesun
Reviews.Content: Needed a clean, safe, convenient place to stay at the airport the night before we left on our very early flight. This hotel was exactly what we were looking for. Airport shuttle was key especially since we were traveling with a baby and had a lot of stuff. Also very close to rental car drop off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Airport Layover”
Reviews.Author: nevermissBoston
Reviews.Content: Great value at this hotel. We stayed on a layover to Hawaii. The shuttle was quick, check in was a breeze. The Hotel is in great shape - clean, comfortable beds, etc. We were surprised at how nice the hotel was for being an "airport" hotel. We will use this hotel again if we have the need to. It was also a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls”
Reviews.Author: travelers-tu
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on our way to Maui.  Room was average the staff very helpful and friendly.  The only problem was we could hear the couple in the next room.  Compared to where we stayed on our return trip it really wasn't that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingASAP
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance LAX is a great hotel. We stayed here for a graduation weekend and had no problems or complaints. The location for us was great as we had easy access to the 405 freeway (minutes away), lots of space in the room and most importantly the staff was most accommodating for our extended family. Special thanks go to Carla and Patrice! Additionally, the convenience of being close to LAX for an early morning departure was very nice. This is the third time that we have chosen this hotel in LA and would definately stay here again. We also were able to obtain a terrific AAA rate of $109 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Before or After Flight...”
Reviews.Author: LookingToEscape
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one night prior to departing via LAX for vacation in Mexico. I chose this hotel as it offered a great Stay and Park offer - I think I paid $129 for one night and 7 nights of parking. I felt that was a great deal. And I think the hotel itself is one of the nicer hotels in the LAX vicinity. Service was very friendly and efficient and we were upgraded to a club room on the 10th floor. Room was nicely appointed and relatively spacious - king bed, nice arm chair w/ ottoman, desk and dresser with flat screen TV. Bed was comfortable. Shower was plenty warm for us in the morning. We ordered room service for breakfast by placing our order on the door the night before: prices on par with just about any other hotel room service menu and they delivered at our requested time. Soundproofing was VERY good - we did not hear a single plane. Overall a very pleasant, albeit short, stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Senoritagringa
Reviews.Content: We had a free miles stay at the Renaissance Montaura, and we stayed for our first and last nights in LA (only two blocks from car rental places). We arrived on the night before Easter, and the hotel was packed. First we were told that we could get an air mattress for our teenage daughter (the room was too small for a cot), then there were none available, and, finally, we had a knock on our door pretty late.....and there was the mattress. We also got a free upgrade on the way back, with a pull-out sofabed. True, the computer connection was expensive, but at least it worked well. The buffet was great (especially free), and the parking expensive (remember to keep your key card to get out of self-parking). Also wasn't crazy about having a knock on our door at 8am to clean the room. But the two best things about the Montaura are 1) it is amazingly quiet....we could not hear the planes taking off or landing almost next to us, and 2) every single person we dealt with in the hotel was friendly, helpful, and kind......to a person. The guys at the desk, the concierge, the guy who helped us get out of the garage, the waiter at the buffet, the guy who brought us a toothbrush.....the best service.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Again! Needs renovation!!”
Reviews.Author: YoungFamilyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I definitely wouldn't stay at this hotel again. Room had a very strong smell of some cheap carpet deoderizer. I think they tried to mask a smoking room. The view was terrible, cords hanging everywhere - not child friendly at all. Linens weren't very nice. A duvet sandwiched between two sheets. Kind of gross considering the duvets most likely aren't washed after each use. Carpet was dirty...hotel is in need of a renovation, even though I think it just had one. No hot water in the morning. Left water running for 10minutes before I was able to get a luke warm shower. Staff was rude and unfriendly when we called asking questions. Building only has one bar style restaurant with very expensive limited selections and no kids menu items. It's close to the airport, but there are no restaurants close by. Parking is $24/night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place To Hang Your Hat”
Reviews.Author: BigdawgChicago
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three days over Oscar weekend to attend a motion picture award dinner honoring a relative. The rate was spectacular-$94 per nite AAA. The room was very clean, comfortable, quiet and the furniture, carpeting and paint was all fresh. Flat screen TV and very comfortable bed. Although the hotel is very close to the north, east to west LAX approach and the arriving aircraft are very close and low, we never heard any of the planes so the rooms must be very well insulated (and we were facing the approach). The fitness room is one of the nicer ones for a hotel-the equipment appeared new and each treadmill (4 or 5) had its own TV with complimentary, new and clean ear buds. There is a separate weight lifting room. Did not eat at the hotel so I cannot comment on the food. Parking was $23 a day but you will pay that at any good LA hotel. I stayed here once before and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel with great gym but expensive Wifi”
Reviews.Author: smerikal
Reviews.Content: Room was very spacious and quiet, no complaints. Breakfast was awesome, well worth 15 bucks paid in advance (would've been 20 on-site) and supported us through the day (we skipped lunch). Consierge was friendly and effective. Wifi would've cost well over 10 bucks per day. Gym was excellent and small outdoor swimming pool was full of chloride, but still better than nothing. Space around the swimming pool was calm and would've made a nice place to relax and read a book. Now why can't I find this hotel from Tripadvisor with a search for 'Marriot' as it belongs to the chain anyway?

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with some good and not so good points”
Reviews.Author: Caraib321
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Montura Hotel Los Angeles is a wonderful hotel with some good and not so good points that should be mentioned. The hotel is around the corner from the Los Angeles Marriott Airport hotel, which I had stayed numerous times before discovering the newer Renaissance Montura Hotel Los Angeles. The Los Angeles Marriott has more a hard rock grand central station atmosphere while the Renaissance Montura has more of a jazzy, upscale and less touristy beat. The rooms are large with a nice size bathroom. The front desk staff is very helpful and courteous. No need to pay the extra fee for Internet if you get a room on the 10th or 11th floor. Use the free wireless connection in the concierge lounge. By the way, the food in the concierge lounge did not impress me. I went one evening and they served some type of beef in a large pan with vegetable sticky rice. The sticky rice was tasty. They also served a tiny 2” X 2” plate with a sliver of cheese, three cranberries, and one apricot. The free beverages included 10 oz bottles of “purified” water, 10 oz bottles of Pellegrino Mineral Water and Pepsi products. The desert included cookies and brownies – great for kids, which by the way seemed to enjoy running around the lounge. Hey, if I was traveling with my kids, I’d let ‘em loose in the concierge lounge too for the kid-friendly breakfast, i.e. cereals, juice, muffins. I took a quick look at the tiny swimming pool and hot tub. As a triathlon swimmer, I’d push off the side and be on the other side in three seconds. The hotel also included a small fitness center with treadmills and a separate weight room. Both included full length mirrors to give a larger room appearance. The staff was absolutely wonderful in terms of customer service! Also, the breakfast buffet for $16.95 is a great deal. I ate at the bar one night and had no complaints about the food. The only complaint I’d mention was the bar should have had high-definition TV for the sports programs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cinderella_gal
Reviews.Content: Not too much to say, except that this was perfect for our overnight stay before our flight out of LAX. The room was very comfortable with needed amenities, and staff was courteous and helpful. It is very close to the airport itself and close to the rental car return which was great. The price was most reasonable, and we would definitely stay here again when we need a room at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: UkLuxtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance hotel for two days in December before flying to Arizona for a holiday. The room was large and well furnished, the bed was very comfortable and it was extremely quiet, despite being next to the airport.
