They really ought to lower the rate for a guest. I ordered room service one morning and found the food to be delivered hot and fast. The menu was good for all diets and had a nice selection. Overall I found this place to be a fine choice for your airport hotel needs. It's also great for early morning departures from LAX. Give the place a try, you will not be disappointed. It's usually a few bucks cheaper than the Marriott that is a quarter mile down the road on Century Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, VERY NICE!”
Reviews.Author: love2travelCO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is VERY nice. The staff were all friendly and very helpful. Our room was decorated beautifully. The beds were absolutely the best, extremely comfortable. We never once heard the airplanes, despite the 3 minute drive to the airport. The only thing we did not like, was during the weekdays, when the business people would leave thier rooms, we could hear them in the hallways and slamming their doors. Parking was a bit expensive $18/day. The location was great, close to the 405 and near gas stations, rental cars and shopping. We will definately return, especially because the room price was so reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: HIohana
Reviews.Content: Since we were arriving late in the evening from Reno, Nevada, thought it would be good to stay close to the airport to have a good nights rest. Found this hotel from trip advisors reviews. We did have some problems due to the a/c not working, though it was beyond the hotels control. After we arrived at 9:30PM, we caught the Marriott hotel shuttle to the hotel. It was crowded, so had to stand for the ride. The driver was very nice, but didn't understand English very well. We got out at the wrong Marriott hotel, but a passenger informed us that we weren't at the correct hotel, so hopped back on. Check in was a breeze, however they did not have a roll away bed as requested, but gave us an aero bed instead. It was great substitute. They gave us a high floor, as well as 2 full size beds which were requested. The problem was that the air conditioning was not working in the rooms so it was very difficult to sleep with the windows open and the planes taking off. At check out, I told them that we didn't have a very good night. They were apologetic, and when I asked for some sort of compensation, they gave a discount on the room, so we were appeased. The room was small, but efficient. The beds were very comfortable, and room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance = Excellance !!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine956
Reviews.Content: After a long search on the TripAdvisor website I chose the Renaissance Montura for an overnight stay at the beginning and end of my trip to Hawaii in June 2007. It was a perfect choice. The hotel is close to LAX and provides a free shuttle to and from the airport. The shuttle runs every 15 minutes and the valet offers free coffee while you wait. The room was very clean and the beds were heavenly. Fluffy comforters and many pillows on top of a wonderful pillowtop matress. Very soundproof. You forget you are a half mile from LAX. The entire staff was very friendly and courteous. Excellent breakfast. You could order from the menu or enjoy their fabulous buffet that included made to order omelets. Awesome service in the restaurant by the staff. I highly recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superclose to LAX, but not noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: UMD_Grad_Student
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel after immediately checking out of the Santa Monica Doubletree due to dissatisfaction. The Renaissance was much nicer, and less than half the price! Rooms were above average and included a refrigerator. Front desk staff recommended a good Mexican restaurant (Cozumel's) and was very efficient. Would absolutely stay here again if we needed to stay around LAX (5 mins to airport). Surprisingly, we were watching planes land all night and no one was awakened by the noise (windows must be extra-soundproof because we couldn't hear a thing!). Head south on Hwy 1 about 5 miles for great shopping, dining, and groceries (Whole Foods).

Reviews.Title: “Best Option for airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: a12548
Reviews.Content: Having an overnight stay from my long flight to Hong Kong, I always try to be careful where I stay when near LAX. For most part the hotels there are sub-par. Since I got a great special rate ($110) and read some good reviews here, I booked one night. The shuttle was excellent, coming every 15 minutes to LAX. The ride is only 10 minutes, check-in staff was really polite and helpful. The room was really nice, beds were excellent. My only problem was the decorative pillow had mysterious brown/ashy looking globs on it. Apparently they arent changed between guest stays. The video check out didnt work but was no big deal. The restaurant had some great food, try the Onion soup at night its a masterpiece. The shuttle back was flawless, the drivers lugged the luggage on board without disgusted looks. The staff seems like a good bunch. 5 stars but I subtract a star for the pillow globs. Id stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel For Everyone"”
Reviews.Author: CANADIAN2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night based on the "Trip Advisor" Reviews. Was not dissapointed. Great service and very close to the airport. Ask the conceirge for a list of nearby restaurants...they gave us a name of an Italian place that was one of the best we have eaten at!

Reviews.Title: “It's the people”
Reviews.Author: Pullman1
Reviews.Content: In my experience, this is the best of the LAX hotels. Everything works. The building, which looks non-descript from the outside, is elegant within, with a handsome marble and art-filled lobby, speedy elevators, and recently renovated (though relatively small) rooms. The lounge is an inviting place to eat and drink a glass of excellent wine; it's large enough to afford privacy, if that's what you wish, but also arranged to make it easy to watch sports on the big-screen TV. My AAA rate provided a club-level room, plus free valet parking, and was actually cheaper than the regular rate at some of the other airport hotels. The club level here is a real pleasure, with good complimentary food at breakfast and in the evening. What really makes this hotel special, however, is its people. Absolutely everyone -- at the door, the front desk, in the lounge, the club room, and at the concierge's desk -- was welcoming, helpful, and very competent. It's a real pleasure to deal with such positive people. I'd return for this reason above all. This is not a luxury hotel, the art work notwithstanding, and the view from the rooms is primarily one of airport parking lots. So I would not recommend the hotel to someone principally interested in vacationing. But whenever I need to stay near the airport in LA, this is my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: cchambers97
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking after I had just arrived into LAX, it was an overall excellent choice of a hotel. The location is great it near car rental (beware the parking per day is approx. 18usd); the hotel offers a complimentary shuttle. Although, I didnt dine in at the hotel there is a restaurant and a Burger King directly across the street. The bed slept very comfortable so at that rate I have no major complaints. No leaks,runs, or anything out of the ordinary. I have to say I was pleased and will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a LAX stopover”
Reviews.Author: Eric_Beylon
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night when connecting at LAX (Marc 31 st to April 1st 2007). Efficient and fast shuttle service from and to airport. Quick check-in and check-out. Comfortable room. Very good breakfast buffet. Good value for money. Only downside is pool (very small and located in an unpleasant courtyard). Eric Beylon

Reviews.Title: “Elegant oasis by a busy airport”
Reviews.Author: Caniac
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here prior to a flight to Hawaii on March 18th. I read the reviews at Tripadvisor and compared it to other nearby hotels. We are Marriott Rewards members and this hotel, based on reviews at this website, sounded perfect for us. After collecting our bags, we picked up the free Marriott shuttle outside baggage claim. The hotel is the 2nd stop on the route....about 2 blocks from LAX and a block from the Marriott LAX, which does not have the same charm as this hotel. The hotel feels intimate, elegant and very clean. It is nicer than the other Marriott nearby. The staff was very accomodating. I asked for a room on an upper floor, facing the runway and got it. The bed was amazing....lots of pillows and crisp white linens...nicely appointed bathroom too. We had a wonderful meal in the diningroom and then sat in the roof top jacuzzi on the 2nd level and watched the planes overhead.. It was a very nice little rooftop garden with pool as well, and fitness center. the breakfast buffet was also very nice. i did go across the street to the Burger King once to get something for my husband but i do not recommend it. It was smokey and did not feel clean. there were alot of people there who seemed a little rough. Even though the hotel is upscale, it is surrounded by rental car parking lots and an industrtial area. I still recommend this hotel to anyone waiting for a connection. It is really a great place to rest. Just don't venture out on the sidewalk at night. One great thing we saw...the landing of the new Airbus which came in from France. Lots of media and police escort. It was quite a sight to see it land from our hotel window. By the way, the hotel is completely soundproof.

Reviews.Title: “Should not be top rated!”
Reviews.Author: Cookswoman
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband for an over night mid-week business trip and was disappointed because it has such a high Trip Advisor rating. While the public areas are tastfully decorated and spacious, the room was quite small and you could hear conversations and tv from adjoining rooms. The bathroom floor was dirty and the floor safe was difficult to reach and impossible to read the instructions. We ate twice in the resturant...$6 for coffee and poor service at breakfast, better at lunch. All in all, I expect more from Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Class A+ all the way.”
Reviews.Author: crestlinecode
Reviews.Content: My credentials: Have collection of 100+ different hotel soaps with wide ranging qualities. My stays: Longest here was 3 consecutive work weeks except for weekends. All business related. Price: Paid 100-118, corporate rate. Property: Not outwardly impressive. Enter and that changes forthwith. It's beautiful with original art throughout entire hotel. And the most important attribute; CLEAN. Staff: Uber-dressed, groomed, polite and ready to serve. No whining or attitudes here. There's even a full-time concierge which you wouldn't expect for the price. Room: Small, but the top-of-the-line linen and granite comfort makes up for that. Never found a hair or an odor, or heard any loud, unacceptable noises in here. Food: I don't believe in paying hotel prices for food so I didn't sample it but it smelled gourmet wonderful. Negatives: Low-key cyclic noise from landing planes. Have to pay for internet. Could not make reservations from the front desk. TV channels minimal. Summary: I've stayed at the other high end hotels around LAX and this place is more comfortable. I have not encountered a single problem here. And the airport noise thing is actually a non-issue because the other places were on the main street into the terminal and the car noise was worse than the planes. And besides that, the way it's set up, you can observe the airplane activity which is really quite interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: tinadam
Reviews.Content: When I checked this site, the hotel was rated #5 in LA, with a base price around $100 less than the other hotels in the top 10. So from that perspective it was an easy choice. Ultimately, though, I think the rating reflects this hotel's convenience as an airport hotel, and the across-the-board quality which limits any really negative reviews. It was a nice stay, clean room, all the amenities that you'd expect-- but certainly nothing to write home about. The hotel is just a few blocks from the airport, right across the street from the Budget Rentacar lot (a nice tip is to use Budget and then return the car the night before you leave, avoiding the extra night rental fee and the extra night parking fee). There's a Burger King across the street, but nothing else of note within sight in any direction in terms of shopping or eating. The hotel charges $17 per night for parking (unlimited in/out priveleges), which seemed extreme, and maybe that's one reason why the room rate is so competetive. No complaints about the room-- I found the heater/ac system to be much better than average, and the bed was very comfy. While the windows are reinforced to keep out most of the airport noise, there was a lot of noise bleeding in from the hallway (our room was close to the elevators), and I was awakened by what sounded like someone using a saw one morning. Don't expect anything spectacular, but rest assured you'll have a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent LAX Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PDXBigGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and was very impressed overall. Was upgraded to the club floor (MR Gold). The Club Lounge was one of the few in the US that is open on the weekend! Breakfast, evening snacks, and dessert were all outstanding, different each day, and amazingly free of any fried food typical of lounge snacks. Room was quiet, large, and clean. The temperature, however, was difficult to control--either too hot or too cold, and the AC was noisy. Excercise room had good equipment and individual TV's. The LAX transit center is a five minute walk to the hotel; from there, you can catch public transit to downtown. For IN-and-Out Burger fans, there is one within a 15 min walk on Sepulveda. Hotel shuttle runs continuously to and from LAX and was very efficient. Would definitely stay at the Montura again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpl88
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Montura is located conveniently very close to LAX - we picked this hotel for the convenience of the location, the competitive rates and because everything was booked where we needed to stay. Overall I'm not sure why this hotel is rated 4.5 on tripadvisor. It really isn't that good. The rooms are very small and uninspiring. The area around is unattractive and doesn't feel safe. Having said that it can't really be faulted for an overnight stay and an airport hotel - the beds are very comfortable and you will have a good night's rest in complete silence. If that's all you're looking for and can secure a good rate you shouldn't be disappointed. Be aware that the hotel was just raising its parking rates to $18 as we stayed there which is outrageous for the location. The Manhattan Beach Marriott 3 miles south is in a nicer location and charges less for parking. If you don't need the airport shuttle I would prefer staying there as it is also near LAX but has nicer rooms and views.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: yvr->ewr
Reviews.Content: Spent the President's Day weekend at the Montura. Got a very reasonable rate of $119 from their website. The hotel is above average in most respects. The valet was quick and courteous. Front desk check-in was smooth. The room was spic and span. I requested and got a high floor with a view of the LAX runways. The room was very quiet even with planes taking off and landing most of the day. I would not hesitate staying at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near LAX”
Reviews.Author: LincolnNavigator
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Rennaissance after a quick trip from to Boston to visit our daughter who goes to college in CA. We needed a hotel to stay at near the airport as our flight out was leaving at 7 AM. I read the reviews of all the hotels near LAX in TripAdvisor and chose the Renaissance based on the feedback. We were not disappointed. The hotel was convenient, clean, and very, very quiet. We felt like the only guests in our part of the hotel. It might even have been a bit creepy, if I was traveling alone on business. But that does not take away from the well-appointed room, and the absolutely divine bed and linens. The pillow-top bed with the soft cotton sheets and duvet were bliss. I dreaded having to get up early to leave as I wanted to luxuriate in the linens all day! The windowpanes must have been tripled-paned, as we could watch the planes land, but did not hear even a slight engine noise. The registration staff was competent, but not overly friendly. The early morning (5 AM) coffee and continental staff were kind, given the early hour. It was nice to be able to grab a cup of Peet's coffee before having to face LAX. The shuttle was on time and one can track its progress with their touch screen kiosk in the lobby. It certainly eased our "getting to the airport" on time anxieties. Once you are on the shuttle the automated voice even tells you how long it will be until you get to the airport. Nice touch. All in all, I would highly recommend the Rennaissance for overnight travelers who need quick access to the airport. I am not sure I would make it my first destination option if it was my first trip to LA. The area around the hotel is asphalt, car rental agencies, and industrial complexes. Pretty grim. But for an overnight, it is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great LAX Location”
Reviews.Author: momtravelswith3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before an early departure from LAX. The Hotel is easy to find and less than 5 minutes from Departure Terminals at LAX. It is part of the Marriott Chain which I like to use whenever possible. It is a beautiful Hotel, very nicely appointed. The check-in desk clerk was very hasty and not overly friendly, but the concierge made up for it. They were very helpful with questions etc. The rooms were average size, the beds were wonderful pillow tops and very comfortable. The bathroom was good size with nice amenities. There was a small fridge in the room as well. The Airport Shuttle was very convenient, it runs continuously 24 hours every 15minutes. No reservations are required, just proceed outside and catch the next bus. Would certainly stay here again for the convenience to the airport. It is also very close to the rental car drop-off locations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect flight recovery!”
Reviews.Author: MrBen1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first night in the USA, as we didn't want to venture far in the rental car on our first night. The location was perfect, very close to the airport, and just one block from the Dollar Rent a car site where we had just picked up our car. As we were tired on arrival (it was early evening, but felt like the early hours to us due to the time zone change), we decided to remain in the hotel, and found the facilities very good, enjoying both the gym and swimming pool, before retiring to the huge bed in our room, watching the 747's landing at LAX with the sunset over the pacific in the background! Beautiful! The front desk staff were very good both on arrival and when checking out, recommending a good local diner for breakfast as we wanted to try a traditional US style pancakes breakfast! The room was very comfortable, and the only slight issue we had was a whistling noise which we found was air coming under the room door. We didn't complain as we found throwing a cushion in front of the door stopped the noise!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: EricInSF
Reviews.Content: Found a great deal (less than $100/night) on the Marriott website for the Montura. Much more intimate than full-line Marriott and one block away. Great bar, great service for the price. Very nice rooms in good condition and immaculate. Club floor rooms are better equipped than other floors. Friendly staff. No WiFi and was never able to get cable internet to work. Self-park was pricey ($17/night). I'd defintely stay again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel bed I've ever slept in!”
Reviews.Author: flexibleflier
Reviews.Content: This is a sweet little hotel located close (but not too close) to LAX. The airplanes can be seen but not so much heard. The staff were warm and always made it a point to greet us when we passed by. The lobby was beautiful and the hallways and other common areas were kept up nicely. The swimming pool, while nothing special, was clean and the spa offered a nice way to end the day. The fitness center looked close to brand-new and had everything you could possibly need including individual TV's and complimentary bottled water. The only complaint I have is that the guest rooms were a bit cramped. We would often bump into one another because there was limited space between the end of the bed and the dresser. However, the beds themselves more than made up for it. They featured duvets and other European-style appointments as well as enormous pillows which made it especially comfortable when sitting up against the headboard. The location of this property is central to everything. It's closest to the South Bay area which includes Redondo and Manhattan Beaches. Hollywood is about a 30-minute drive as long as you stay off the freeways. All in all, I would recommend this property, especially to business travelers or people who only have a few days to spend in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jimette
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, A & J October 17th, 2006, PA We stayed here one night after a long flight home from Fiji. Our check in went smoothly. Our room was very clean. Bed was a pillowtop, rooms are sound proof & smoke free hotel. After we showered and changed the concierge, Sergio gave us some good advise on where to go for dinner & a map. They also went out and hailed us a cab right away. After we returned we had cocktails over looking LA in their Club House and talking with the friendly staff. In the morning we woke up to a newspaper & delicious breakfast in the hotel. The Airport shuttle came right away and took us to our terminal free of charge. This is a nice place to stay if even for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: CatdogCT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were satisfied with the stay; the rooms were a bit small for more than an overnight stay (or perhaps the furniture was too large for the room as noted in some of the other reviews). Overall property was clean, well appointed, and convient to major freeway(s), beaches, and the airport. We did not take advantage of any of the restaurants or other facilities the hotel offered since we spent our days sightseeing. We requested additional pillows and towels (the room was set up with only 2 of each), and they arrived promptly and with a smile. Valet parking always had car ready after calling from room and heading downstairs within 5 minutes or so. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very nicely done rooms near LAX”
Reviews.Author: MLE642
Reviews.Content: We booked here thru a Marriott promotional rate ($89/night) for a layover at LAX. The shuttle was prompt. Rooms were surprisingly pleasant for an airport hotel. Our room faced the runways (evidently that was a prime location for the nightime view) and the windows were so well sealed, we didn't hear a thing. We didn't have a car and the concierge helpfully directed us to a free shuttle a block away that went to Manhattan Beach (the beach and to a mall there). It was a great way to pass a long afternoon. The hotel restaurant (we ate in the "coffee shop") was very pretty, had a decent selection and the food was done nicely (not amazing but good for being at the airport). Yuo got the feeling that the hotel staff really did want you to enjoy your stay, even if it was a short one. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great start!”
Reviews.Author: Nasha
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here at the start of our holiday! We only stayed for two nights while we got over any jet lag. Its a really nice clean hotel and a very short drive from the airport. We stayed for 2 nights, which due to the hotels location, is about enough really, as there are nicer areas to stay for a holiday. We had to pay for parking our hire car, which was something we hadn't really thought about.

Reviews.Title: “Far Better Then I ever Expected! Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: HeyTraveler
Reviews.Content: My family am I stayed here two nights for a reunion of sorts in torrence. At First the the appearance of the Hotel from the out side looked alot like any nearby hotel, fairly ordinary, but once you have checked-in and checked out the place it was very comfortable, very clean and very friendly. The room we had (9th floor) was well organized, very clean and very quiet. I loved the bed and wished I could have taken it home with me, it was that comfortable; and the linen was incredably soft and warm. Our room rate ($119) included breakfast for two adults and children under 12 free. I was expecting a basic continental but it turned out to be a fairly comprehensive buffet style with white table clothes and full service. They do have a menu if you choose. We also ate dinner one night and again I was very impressed. The Sword Fish with lobster sauce was increadable. Take your time though, it's not a fast service restaurant during dinner time, but if you are in a hurry, there is a burger King accross the street , which you never see unless driving by to get to the hotel parking garage ($13.00 per night by the way). There appears to alot of convetion space here if needed, excersize room, pool (small / 4Ft deep max), and a well appointed lobby to just hang and watch the world go by. The Freeway (I-405) is minutes away with good signes to direct you where to go. I will defintely stay there again when in town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: saccuch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we needed a hotel for one night near LAX. It was really a surprisingly nice hotel. Very comfortable. Very quiet. Nice facilities (but tiny pool). I would definitely recommend this to anyone needing a first class hotel near LAX, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good as an airport hotel, less good for long stays1”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: I guess the key thing that I need to remember when reviewing this Renaissance Hotel is that it is an airport hotel, and I have been staying at the hotel for extended periods of sometimes up to 10 days. The hotel is really designed to give people in transit staying, I suspect, for an average of one or maybe two nights. That is why I tend to rate the hotel as fine and may other people on tripadvisor.com would rave about the hotel. The hotel has been going through a process of staggered renovation and there has been a real improvement in the quality and state of the bedrooms. One improvement, in my view, being the beds! These are definitely soft, comfortable and have piles of pillows to snuggle down into at night. The rooms are a good size, both the normal rooms and the suites although the latter tend to be fairly dark. There is usually good space to do work, good internet access and fairly good bathrooms with great water pressure. The one thing that is a pity they have not addressed is the air conditioning which is very boisterous and noisy, and I have found that I need to leave it off when going to bed at night and so in summer the rooms get hot and bit uncomfortable over night. The other area that is not great is the bar and dining facilities. The bar is small and not that exciting and the food is pretty average and limited. So while this is fine when there for a night or maybe two, if you stay any longer then you tire of the food. The problem being that as this is a hotel airport there is nowhere to pop out and walk to for an alterative meal. There is a small outdoor pool that is very popular, with small hot tub. The gym is pretty good with a range of cardio equipment to keep most people happy with TVs above each. The weights area is very limited but fine again for a work out. The hotel has a large parking garage with self parking or valet parking. The view from rooms in the front of the hotel are over the airport and worth asking for when you check in - or you get the view of the multi story car park (which you will see I always have had!) So this is a good hotel for an airport hotel, probably good for a conference as is so handy for the airport but not a hotel to spend longer in. One thing as an aside is although planes come really close to the hotel the hotel is very sound proof and even between rooms is very well insulated! A tips is that you can get amazing rates for club room access at the weekend (from a Thursday to a Monday check-out) off their website. You can see videos I made of 2 of the rooms at this link: http://blog.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=blog.view&friendID=89511767&blogID=159775462

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Very Nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kymmberly
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended hotel. Across the street from LAX and around the corner from various car rental agencies. Comfy rooms, very clean, superb service. The only negative is the parking garage unless you valet.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for LAX”
Reviews.Author: joviscot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice recently - for 2 days at the start of my vacation and for 2 days at the end of it. No complaints either time. Anytime we needed directions anywhere, the hotel staff were only too happy to help. We received printouts with all the information we needed. Rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet considering the planes fly so close to the hotel. It was easy to get the shuttle bus to and from the hotel. Would stay here again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: ScorpionQueen103169
Reviews.Content: Very recently my grandmother and I visited Los Angeles for the funeral of her sister. Unfortunately, the family friend we were staying with in LA, was hospitalized. Our plans were to arrive on Friday, participate in the funeral on Saturday and leave on the red-eye Sunday evening. When we were unable to secure a standby flight out of Los Angeles, we were left with the need for hotel accomodations. I called every area hotel and there were no rooms available. Believing that the Renaissance was far out of our price range, I called as a last resort. I spoke to the most delightful man, Mario. After explaining the situation to him about the flight, he encouraged us to take the next shuttle to him and he will have a room ready. I was skeptical, because no one else had room for us, regardless of our situation. Sure enough when we got off the shuttle, Mario was there waiting for us, with a welcoming smile and a ready room. The service was superb. The staff was extraordinary. Their service made our situation more tolerable. And the shower is to "die for". Thank you for making our stay pleasurable and for delivering the service that was promised, and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms here during my daughter's graduation from UCLA last weekend (6/16 & 6/17). My daughter and son-in-law and their two babies (under 2yrs) didn't arrive until well after midnight, very tired and frustrated from driving for nine hours. When they got to their room, they found a snack tray waiting for them - with grapes, apple slices, peanut butter-and-jelly sandwiches - and a handwritten note saying there was milk in the refrigerator below. I didn't request the tray and don't know who put it there for them, but it was beyond wonderful for them to have it there. Someone mentioned the elevator arrangement. There is a separate elevator for the parking garage and you do have to then go through the lobby to reach the elevators to the floors, but we considered this to be a good security measure as there is then no outside access to the floors. We also had reservations for dinner for our family after my daughter's graduation, in the Conservatory. I have to say that the waiters were wonderful - put up with everyone straggling in half-an-hour late and numerous special requests for the kids. This was a wonderful hotel and spotlessly clean. It is gorgeous inside as they are doing a big renovation. We will stay there again every time we go down to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for LAX access but not near much”
Reviews.Author: haji
Reviews.Content: I was here for a three-day conference held at the Sheraton in the same area. The hotel is very convenient to get to LAX but there is nothing else around - no restaurants, no nightlife, no sites to see. The nearest area for any type of activity was about a 15-20 minute car ride from the hotel. The hotel itself was very nice. It was clean and the staff was helpful. There is a daily charge for parking and the spaces are unbelievable small. If you get back to the hotel late at night be prepared for not being able to find a spot or having to use a can opener to get out of your car because the SUV next to you can't fit within the tiny space alloted. We didn't eat at the restaurant on-site. The menu looked good but it was very pricey. The rooms were nice and comfortable. The club lounge offers complimentary breakfast, hors d'ourves, and wireless internet but no complimentary alcohol. Other people in our conference stayed at the Sheraton and said that they did not like the rooms, but I thought the public areas looked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Montura-Doubtful”
Reviews.Author: debraacook
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days, arriving on a Friday evening at about midnight. We expected Room Service to be limited. When I called, I was told limited service selections meant pre-made sandwiches (two to choose from) and a pre-made salad. Very disappointing, especially since the hotel is across from the airport and people are arriving at all hours. I was directed to Denny's, IHOP, or Carl's Jr. There were no other choices. For the most part, the room itself was clean. The cabinet door housing the mini refrigerator was a little askew. The refrigerator itself did not reach a very cold temp, despite the fact that we turned it all the way to the coldest setting. Upon entering the room, you will see two bottles of imported water. Don't open them unless you want to spend $3.50 and $4.50 each and they are not worth it at all. When we checked in, the garage elevator was out of order. There is only one elevator for the garage, which is a seperate structure adjacent to the hotel. This meant we needed to walk down four flights of stairs with our luggage, walk across the corridor to the hotel elevator and go up to our room, only to take the same route again to go out for a meal that the hotel room service could not provide. The desk gave excellent driving directions, however. It is doubtful that we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would be great at even twice the price”
Reviews.Author: Williamson5
Reviews.Content: A terrific hotel overall. Very close to LAX, walking distance to the Hertz and Avis lots, excellent service from the welcoming and competent staff (one of the fastest check-ins I've ever had at any hotel), fantastic bed, extremely clean bathroom, excellent food in the concierge lounge, marble top furniture, live plant in the guest room, beautiful artwork throughout the property. I still can't believe I only paid $109 per night. My only complaint was the airport shuttle, which is shared with a number of other hotels and makes a number of stops before getting to the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasent stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: blueocean_explorer
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself left a lot to be desired! Before I booked the hotel, I glanced over its website and figured that this is a great hotel due to those misleading photos on the hotel's website. All in all, I have to say that this is a terrible hotel. The lobby is appointed in dark colors. This made the whole enviroment looked gloomy. The rooms were OK, however I expect more from a Renaissance Hotel! The bed was hard and the beddings were below average! On the other hand, since the hotel is nearby the airport, is is very noisy 24 hours a day!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the LAX area”
Reviews.Author: kurock_chalk
Reviews.Content: I travel to LA twice a month and always stay at the Renaissance. I used to stay at the LAX Marriott but the property has gotten so run down that I personally feel unsafe. Not at the Renaissance though. The rooms, the bar, the lobby, the staff, the food, the gym are all exceptional. I really like how quiet the hotel is at all times. I work late in the evening and so I sleep in until around 9:00am. I am never waken by the maid service in other rooms or hallway. The only recommendation would be to upgrade the breakfast in the concierge lounge. It is usually just OK. Frankly, Residence Inns have been breakfast choices. Other than that small detail, this hotel is home away from home. Thank you Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to stay near the airport this is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mick909
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night on our way back from NY to Sydney. We had also stayed at the Radisson LAX the night before, but the Renaissance wins hands down. The room was some 30% cheaper, the night we stayed, the beds more comfortable, the room a little larger, but what really stood out was the service. They have something called "delighted to serve" which I thought would be some cheesy corporate service standard that they just put up to say they have good service. But they actually all seemed to be genuinely delighted to serve you. Everyone staff member we ran into or dealt with was extremely courteous, pleasant and nothing was too much trouble. A rarity in American hotels. If we have to stay near LAX, we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: ncmurray
Reviews.Content: Based on this web site, we stayed at this hotel at the beginning and end of our trip to California. What a beautiful hotel! The staff was friendly, the concierge service was efficient and knowledgable, the breakfast was great! A bonus was the proximity to the rental car places - an easy walk to pick up and drop off our car, saving us a day's car rental fees! What a great hotel at any price, but the value was amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Greataunt
Reviews.Content: We stayed last week on our way to Palm Springs. The flight landed late and we made our way over to the Renaissance. The front desk personnel were delightful and our club level room was fantastic. We'd booked the Romance package and they had already layed out the rose petals when we got into the room. Our champagne and strawberries arrived shortly thereafter. Breakfast the next morning was delicious. It was a first class experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a great location. Close to car rentals and LAX (1-2 miles). Closest car rental is Budget across the street. We rented from Hertz which is one block from hotel, extremely convenient, can walk there. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Room is very clean and decent size. Furniture is a little big for the room but there was still plenty of room for two people. For women - bring your own blow dryer if you need to use it for more than five minutes. I have long hair and it kept shutting off to cool down after about 2 minutes of use on medium heat, what a nuisance. Parking was $13 per day in the garage. Did not use valet service. Never heard the airplanes and our stay was very quiet and restful. Would gladly stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Renaissance Montura Los Angeles
HotelInfo.Address: 9620 Airport Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90045
